page.title: 181980s Transport on Horse-Eye
page.content: Modern transport and large vehicles have become an accepted essential for todays way of life. However, large agricultural machinery is often too wide for narrow country lanes with resulting damage to verges, hedgerows and road surfaces. Public Transport does not serve Horse-Eye Level & the local Post Bus Service has been discontinued. The residential caravan park is served by a volunteer bus service called the Hailsham Town Bus Limited. The bus is driven by volunteers, providing four services daily, Monday to Friday and Saturday morning, with a flat fare of 15p. The bus can be privately hired evenings & weekends. Local businesses sponsor the volunteer bus. Without this bus service many people would be isolated. The area is under a flight path to Gatwick Airport.
